title: Word Counter
description:
Build a word frequency counter using HashMap.

## Requirements

1. Implement `count_words(text: &str) -> HashMap<String, usize>`
   - Count occurrences of each word (case-insensitive)
   - Words are separated by whitespace

2. Implement `most_common(counts: &HashMap<String, usize>, n: usize) -> Vec<(String, usize)>`
   - Return the n most common words with their counts
   - Sort by count (descending), then alphabetically for ties

testCases.assertion: most_common(&count_words("a b c a b a"), 2).len() == 2
{ let m = most_common(&count_words("a b a c a b"), 2); m[0].0 == "a" && m[0].1 == 3 }
{ let m = most_common(&count_words("b a b a"), 2); m[0].0 == "a" || m[0].1 == m[1].1 }

hints: Use text.split_whitespace() to split on any whitespace
For most_common, collect into a Vec, then sort with sort_by
sort_by(|a, b| b.1.cmp(&a.1).then(a.0.cmp(&b.0))) sorts by count desc, then name asc
